body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
/kind bug

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line:
>
> /kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
1. In order to watch individual changes to a list of Pod, [Kubernetes api reference v1.10](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.10/#watch-list-65) says that HTTP request should be made to endpoint `GET /api/v1/watch/namespaces/{namespace}/pods` but while executing e2e tests it is found that **Watch Function** on Pod is hitting api-endpoint `GET /api/v1/namespaces/{namespace}/pods`

2. While executing e2e test suit `GET /api/v1/watch/namespaces/{namespace}/pods` endpoint is never observed.

**What you expected to happen**:
Watch function should make request to `/api/v1/watch/namespaces/{namespace}/pods` endpoint with `GET` HTTP verb to watch individual changes to a list of Pod. (based on API reference documentation) or Documentation needs correction based on observed endpoint `/api/v1/namespaces/{namespace}/pods`.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:


**Anything else we need to know?**:
Some references of Pod specific API endpoints hit during e2e test execution are -
1. https://github.com/cncf/k8s-conformance/issues/220#issuecomment-393344061
2. https://github.com/cncf/apisnoop/issues/17#issuecomment-394866106

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Others:

cc @wangzhen127 @rohfle @AishSundar

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

title: Ambiguity to find pod specific watch api endpoints in e2e test suite
